column1: Why did they buy those products in specific ? [SEP] This morning I went to Wal - Mart to buy deodorant and soap . Funny that I should simultaneously run out of those things . While I was there , " Who Let the Dogs Out " was playing . It was playing when I came in , and I swear , it went on for like 6 minutes . [SEP]  (A) They wanted to spend as little money as possible . (B) They did n't like the products they already had . (C) They need them to keep themselves clean . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: They need them to keep themselves clean .

column1: Why might the writer be agitated ? [SEP] I ' ve been awake for an hour and i ' ve already smoked 3 cigarettes . my computer is going to die soon , and by die i mean fucking die forever and it wo nt ever come back . i m scared . [SEP]  (A) The writer may feel guilty for smoking . (B) The writer might need more sleep . (C) The writer might be lonely . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: Why did the narrator feel they needed to go to their room ? [SEP] It was really hard to breath and I thought I was going to faint in the hallway in my towel . I got back to my room and took a zantac , and I was a little better . In bed though , I felt faint again but not nearly as severely , and my hands were shaking . [SEP]  (A) They were wanting a nap . (B) None of the above choices . (C) They needed sleep . (D) They needed to take medicine .
column2: They needed to take medicine .

column1: Why is the narrator thanking her parents ? [SEP] My dad still treats me like his little girl and always worries that we are doing okay . Thanks mom and dad for a great weekend ! ! We love you and are looking forward to seeing you again next week ! [SEP]  (A) They treated her well as a little girl and teen . (B) They treated her well when she was a little girl . (C) They treated her well through her youth . (D) They treated her well on the weekend .
column2: They treated her well on the weekend .

column1: Why did the narrator feel they needed their phone ? [SEP] I spent 4 hours in emergency last night , wishing my mobile phone had internet access with which to entertain me . A midwife did a urinalysis which showed nothing . She was n't interested in my jar o ' clots . [SEP]  (A) They had texts to answer . (B) They had a lot of free time . (C) They had emergency calls to make . (D) They had loved ones to ignore .
column2: They had a lot of free time .

column1: What is the reason I am impressed with macbook ? [SEP] I got my macbook pro last week and I am impressed . I am already running lots of apps including Parallels . So far no big problems . I installed the OSX update and it went well . [SEP]  (A) I heard from Steve Jobs from the grave . (B) I got free updates . (C) It is very cheap . (D) I like the fact that I am able to run a lot of apps and the laptop is working well .
column2: I like the fact that I am able to run a lot of apps and the laptop is working well .

column1: What is a likely reason that the speaker sent a delusional message to R ? [SEP] Page 516 ! Uni readings done for the day too , so should be clear to finish up tonight . Last night I sent a deranged message to R along the lines of " Hahaha sucked in ! Bet he did nt see THAT coming ! " [SEP]  (A) The speaker was profoundly intoxicated and as a result their judgement had become comprimised (B) The speaker did n't mean to send the text and they were only typing it as a joke and accidentally hit send (C) None of the above choices . (D) They were somewhat sleep deprived and as a result their judgement had become compromised
column2: They were somewhat sleep deprived and as a result their judgement had become compromised

column1: who might the girls have been ? [SEP] As I was backing out of the garage today , I looked over and saw the girls licking each others necks . It was almost as if they were grooming each other maybe ? I hopped out of the Tahoe and ran in to get my camera . [SEP]  (A) Daughters of the narrator (B) Pets of the narrator (C) Neighbours of the narrator (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Pets of the narrator

column1: What may happen in the future between me and my sister ? [SEP] My sister and her BF are going to be renting a house not far from mine and sending her daughter to my daughter 's school . She asked if she could drop my niece off at my house before school as my sister starts work at 6 am and then we take them both to school . I have no problems with this as I think my niece needs more attention than my sister gives her and she loves seeing my children . HOWEVER , instead of picking my niece up from school afterwards ( my sis is off in time to pick her up ) , she 's paying for after school care so that she does n't have to get my niece until 6 at the latest . [SEP]  (A) I will offer to pick up my niece so my sister can take advantage of me some more . (B) We 're going to end up in a big confrontation because of the way she neglects my niece . (C) I will talk to my sister 's boyfriend and try to get him involved in the child 's care . (D) I will talk to my niece and see if she might like to come live with me and my children .
column2: We 're going to end up in a big confrontation because of the way she neglects my niece .

column1: Why did we lock the doors ? [SEP] Twins told their neighbor we would be gone until Sunday , We checked the house , locked the doors , hit the gas , and open road here we come . We put our next student pilot lesson CD in the player ( basic flight safety practices and procedures ) . Later one of the twins got a book out of her backpack and they started reading to me . One would read and the other twin would make the sounds . [SEP]  (A) Because we put our next student pilot lesson CD in the player . (B) Because we checked the house . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Because we hit the gas .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: What reason might someone dress up in such an outfit ? [SEP] Whether it flattered them , was so gorgeous , or just FIERCE ( ! ) , they were a cosplayer 's dream , and if you lived in the avatarverse , those would be your clothes . OR It was an outfit or disguise that was just too darn funny . [SEP]  (A) They were flattered into dressing in those clothes . (B) They were role playing in costume . (C) They wanted to look funny in the avatarverse . (D) They were in disguise as a cosplayer .
column2: They were role playing in costume .

column1: What may be the reason Todd is smelling the shirt ? [SEP] He could smell him - Jack , his lover - on the shirt , and he took a deep breath , knowing that in about an hour or so he 'd be smelling the real thing . " Well , look who 's back , " came a voice , and Ennis whirled around . There stood Todd , the 20-year - old stick boy , who handled the team 's equipment and made sure the sticks were out on the ice for games . [SEP]  (A) He may have a crush on the coach of the team . (B) He may have a crush on Jack or his lover . (C) None of the above choices . (D) He want to see if he can sense what brand it is .
column2: He may have a crush on Jack or his lover .

column1: What is the reason that the relationship died ? [SEP] However , utopia83 brought up the valid issue of : what about Jake ? To which I flippantly replied , " Obviously they broke up " and then added in a less light tone " possibly he died tragically " . Which sort of would make sense . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) Jake cheated on her . (C) Jake was killed . (D) Jake was cheated on .
column2: Jake was killed .

column1: What was it that I asked the programmer if he knew anything about ? [SEP] " What do you know about protein shakes ? " I asked the programmer , ready with my pencil and pad in hand for him to rattle off some " you need x to x to x ratio of whey protein plus amino something or other and some other magical compound " recommendation . Instead , I got a blank look from the top of the stairs . Then ... " Nothing , " he said . [SEP]  (A) Protein shakes (B) None of the above choices . (C) Hard drives (D) Computers
column2: Protein shakes

column1: Where will I sleep tonight ? [SEP] There are 66 of us this time round , and quite a few from non - local universities . There are only 13 guys and maybe 10 SMU people . These people are in my group , and I am so thankful for A and C who talk to me , take care of me and make me laugh . The good news is that I have a whole room all to myself . [SEP]  (A) I will go home . (B) I sleep in a room alone . (C) I will share a room with A and C. (D) I will sleep at SMU .
column2: I sleep in a room alone .

column1: How might I be feeling after I come back from the swim ? [SEP] today was nice . the kind of day that i wanted today was having a summer day like i was a kid . i mowed the yard , and i rode my bike to the pool to swim . we would ride out bikes to swim every single day during the summer way back when , and when we got back home , mom would already have sandwiches ready for us to eat when we were dried out from the sun . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) I might be feeling nostalgic and annoyed . (C) I might be feeling nostalgic and hungry . (D) I might be feeling annoyed and full .
column2: I might be feeling nostalgic and hungry .

column1: Why did Elka and the narrator want to grill ? [SEP] That simple ... Anyway , it was , quite nice to met these people , I kind of ... like them , after all . For the next day we ( I mean Elka and me ) had planned grill . But quite out of the blue , the weather changed -- it rained and that was serious threat to the whole grill idea . Fortunately Elka decided to move our party to the attic of her house and put grill on the balcony , under parasol . [SEP]  (A) They only ate meat . (B) None of the above choices . (C) They wanted to have a social gathering . (D) They wanted to try out the new grill .
column2: They wanted to have a social gathering .

column1: Whose house was the narrator seeking ? [SEP] On Saturday we ventured out at about 14h30 to go and find V 's house . Malcolm works with him and he was having a little exhibition of his photographic achievements at his home on the north side of Dublin . Malcolm had received an email invitation and had a look at the map book to plan our route . We decided to walk and luas as it was fairly far from us . [SEP]  (A) They were off to see their friend in Dublin . (B) They were off to see Malcolm . (C) None of the above choices . (D) They were off to see Malcolm 's place .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: What may be the reason why they ca n't quit french fries ? [SEP] I have a vague idea that a prior bloodletting from several years ago produced a higher cholesterol number , so it seems that my healthy eating plan is working . Now if I would just quit the french fries .... At any rate , I appear to be healthy as a horse . Of course , I go in tomorrow for a pap smear , and she 's going to schedule me for a mammogram ( my first ! eeek ! ) [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) Because they do n't like the french fries . (C) Because they taste too good . (D) Because it 's their least favorite food .
column2: Because they taste too good .

column1: Where does the subject think he 's going ? [SEP] His prayer life was one of the strongest I had ever witnessed . As Marsha , my sister - in - law , observed , " He 's connected . " In a conversation I had with him just a couple of days before he died , he said he was content - everyone has to go sometime and this is his time I said " And you know where you are going ? " He said , ' That is what I am praying for . " I think everyone in this church knows where dad went - straight up . My dad touched us in so many ways , each time leaving a blessed indelible mark . Just like in the Frank Capra film , he has changed the world for the better by touching so many people 's lives . [SEP]  (A) He thinks he 's going to go to heaven . (B) He thinks he 's going to hell . (C) He thinks he 's not going anywhere . (D) He thinks he 's going home .
column2: He thinks he 's going to go to heaven .

column1: Why did she feel so unusual ? [SEP] Her head swelled with such a tremendous feeling which she had never experienced before . Her body felt starved and desperate for his kiss , though she wanted nothing of the sort . " Stop it ! " [SEP]  (A) She had a case of encephalitis . (B) She had n't eaten in days . (C) She was in love for the first time . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: She was in love for the first time .

column1: What may be the reason Elvis is so happy to see me ? [SEP] Ca n't believe I am back for good this time . It really felt great to unpack my bag knowing that I wo n't need to pack it again tomorrow . Little Elvis The Cat , too , was happy to have me back . We cuddled the whole Sunday . Am sitting in my office and feel slightly strange . Have n't got a clue what to do because I have been away from my projects for six weeks . [SEP]  (A) He was tired of having to cover my projects while I was gone . (B) He wanted some food because no one fed him while I was gone . (C) I have not been home for a month and a half and he missed me . (D) He missed his Saturday cuddle time with me .
column2: I have not been home for a month and a half and he missed me .

column1: Why is the narrator going on so many dates ? [SEP] To say yes to dates ( within reason * ) , to go out more often , to chat people up ( even to approach people ) . The whole point of this I guess is to use my own to change my life . One date at a time . [SEP]  (A) The narrator is looking for the right partner . (B) The narrator is looking for a casual relationship . (C) The narrator is looking for nothing serious . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: The narrator is looking for the right partner .

column1: What might be true about Woolsey 's characterisation ? [SEP] The fact that it did n't was nice characterisation : I empathised with Woolsey and believed that experience had been painful for him , and he still asked the difficult question at the end . 9 . Rodney / Keller -- I ' m fine with this . [SEP]  (A) His characterization is painful . (B) Woolsey does n't ask questions . (C) It is n't relatable . (D) It 's relatable .
column2: It 's relatable .

column1: Why is the narrator telling Liette to change the subject ? [SEP] There is no need to dredge up all this history , especially not for some Bosmer that no one trusted in the first place . You seem more clever than that ... what 's Liette going to do for you ? Let this matter die and I have a little proposition for you . [SEP]  (A) The narrator feels that Liette is being a peacemaker . (B) The narrator feels that Liette is causing drama in the area . (C) None of the above choices . (D) The narrator feels that Liette 's subject is too light and airy .
column2: The narrator feels that Liette is causing drama in the area .

column1: Why is Kripke getting so excited ? [SEP] " Dong , dong , dong " the opening to AC DC 's Hells Bells began to play , Kripke knew his time had come . The howling of the Hell Hounds made the hair on the back of his neck stand up . This was it . [SEP]  (A) She loves ACDC . (B) She loves the sound " dong dong dong " . (C) She loves hell hounds . (D) She loves the sound of bells .
column2: She loves ACDC .

column1: What sport is the narrator poor at ? [SEP] I sucked at tennis , seriously . I played like crap , and it made me so frustrated ! I ve been so stressed out , and when I ' m stressed I eat more . And if I eat more . [SEP]  (A) They are bad at badminton . (B) They are bad at racquetball . (C) They are bad at racket sports . (D) They are bad at basketball .
column2: They are bad at racket sports .

column1: According to the narrator , what may be true about their employer ? [SEP] Hello . I have the internet again . And my computer is nt broken . ish . Tomorrow I am going home again . Kinda ridiculous . I messed up my shoulder at Old Navy . Maybe its because they treat me like a WORK SLAVE ! [SEP]  (A) You will mess up your shoulder at Old Navy . (B) Old Navy treats the employees badly . (C) Old Navy is kind of ridiculous . (D) None of the above choices .

column1: Why might the neighbours have been disruptive ? [SEP] Today did n't turn out too bad considering I got about 4 hours sleep , courtesy of our new neighbours and arrived at work in a filthy mood . At least it meant I got up and showered early , so I do n't have to wash my hair tonight . If they 're up all night again tonight though , there will be severe trouble . [SEP]  (A) They might work night shifts (B) None of the above choices . (C) They might have had an emergency (D) They might have been playing loud music
column2: They might have been playing loud music

column1: What may be the reason why they do n't want to tell their mom ? [SEP] I ' m screwed . I really do n't want my mom to come home from work b / c I really do not want to tell her . Yesterday we were scared b / c it sounded like all of this might happen and we do n't really have the money for it . [SEP]  (A) They do n't want to be blamed for it . (B) They want to fix it before she gets home . (C) They do n't want to disappoint their mom . (D) They do n't want to deliver the bad news .
column2: They do n't want to deliver the bad news .

column1: What hobby has the narrator seemed to have taken up ? [SEP] Because my DSLR has a cropped sensor ( i.e. it 's not a full 35 mm sensor this is about an 80 mm equivalent , or a slight telephoto ) If you 're not familiar with the concept of replaceable lenses on cameras then I 'll quickly explain . A prime lens is one with a fixed focal length , i.e. [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) They have taken up collecting antiques . (C) They have taken up photography . (D) They have taken up sports .
column2: They have taken up photography .

column1: What do you know about the writer ? [SEP] I guess that 's another reason why I wanted to make this blog ... I want to be honest for once . Whew so this was a long one . I think I ' m going to go ahead and end this one . I hope you enjoyed reading this . And I do hope you 'll come back for more . [SEP]  (A) They write for themself (B) They do not like long posts (C) They are shy about writing (D) They post their writing online
column2: They post their writing online
